baseline_groups.claim_summary: Child marriage bans reduce the probability of marriage before age 18, with effects proportional to pre-ban regional child marriage prevalence.
baseline_groups.notes: Primary claim. did/fe/twoway and robust/cluster/countryregionurban are exact duplicates of baseline.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Child marriage bans increase years of female education.
baseline_groups.notes: Secondary outcome. robust/outcome/educ is a duplicate.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Child marriage bans increase female employment probability.
baseline_groups.notes: Secondary outcome. robust/outcome/employed is a duplicate.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Child marriage bans increase the age at first marriage.
baseline_groups.notes: Secondary outcome. robust/outcome/marriage_age is a duplicate.

global_notes: Analyzed using SIMULATED DATA (not actual DHS/MACHEquity data). Many duplicate specs across robust/outcome and did/ branches. Primary claim is G1 (child marriage reduction); G2-G4 are secondary outcomes. Heterogeneity splits classified as noncore since they test subgroup effects.
